title: US federal agents shoot dead another person in Minneapolis
subhead: A video circulating on social media – and confirmed by authorities – shows several agents, including at least one wearing a vest marked 'POLICE,' surrounding a person on the ground and hitting him multiple times. Several gunshots are heard.

title: What Gazans say about the US's 'New Gaza' plan
US seeks to use Alberta to destabilize Canada
Faure, Glucksmann, Hollande: The rivals to lead France's social democrats in 2027 race
subhead: Pursuing different strategies, Socialist leader Olivier Faure, MEP Raphaël Glucksmann and former president François Hollande all hope to capture the broad center-left space ahead of the presidential election.

title: Generative AI, psychiatry and the risks of self-service therapy
subhead: Millions of people use chatbots like ChatGPT to share their distress, and the scientific community has warned about the risks vulnerable people face. Generative AI has shaken up psychiatric consultations, fueled tech giants' ambitions and emerged as a credible tool for analyzing pathologies.

title: West African design is finally showcased at home
subhead: They have shown their work at the world's leading design fairs, but never in their home countries. The Palais de Lomé in Togo has brought together, for the first time on the continent, the crème de la crème of West African designers.

title: France is considering banning phones in high schools. This school near Paris already does.
subhead: The Lycée Michelet, a large school complex with 2,300 students, banned mobile phones in its hallways in April 2025. School officials report positive results from a decision made in agreement with the entire educational community.

title: Trump praises UK troops after outrage from NATO allies over Afghanistan comments

'We were walking in blood': Iran's doctors recount crackdown on protesters
subhead: From crowded emergency rooms to apocalyptic scenes in Iranian cities, healthcare workers told Le Monde about the violence that descended on protesters calling for the end of the Iranian regime from January 8.

title: 'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
subhead: Donald Trump's second term has turned the United States into a threat to which the rest of the world has no choice but to adapt. Yet, over the past eight decades, habits and practices have taken root that will be used to counter this new imperialism, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: How surveillance companies track smartphone users through advertising data
subhead: Companies are offering law enforcement agencies the ability to track smartphone users through advertising data gathered on their devices. Le Monde attended confidential presentations of these new surveillance tools to learn more.

title: The EU's emancipation from the US requires clarity and resolve
A brief respite in the transatlantic crisis
